intro: Teucrium pseudiva, commonly known as false germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Teucrium pseudiva is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands.
